summary: A temple of the Eight converted into a player home in Riverwood, made to fit as well as it can in town.
descriptionHtml:
This has become *my* player home in Skyrim. The main file doesn't rely on any of the DLC's, for people who want a much more vanilla home. I like making something more beautiful to work with the world of Skyrim, and hopefully this pleases everyone greatly.

[size=4][b]Dragestein Chapel[/b][/size] used to belong to a Knight of the Nine who frequently studied with the Greybeards, and after the White Gold Concordat, received visions of a Dragonborn to make his home there. Here, on the banks of the White River, just outside the Riverwood bridge, this home has many and more of what you'd need in a player home. Two manikins, many weapon plaques, crafting stations, a double bed and single bed, and secret room. Besides for the necessities and clutter, I always want to make something immensely pleasing to the eyes. I have also given the place a proper day/night cycle!

Requires:
- Skyrim's latest version
- The Update

Installation:
- Only one file to place in your Skyrim > Data folder.

Location:
- Just northeast of Riverwood, by the bridge out of town.

Known incompatibilities:
- Anything using the Riverwood03 cell and surrounding land, including Castle Riverwood, Gentesters' White River Cottage, Jack Ga's Pub, and my Beckwood Manor. I'll see if anything can be done about incompatibilities when they come to light.

And videos here, made by the kind SplitztikzGaming and Thyworm!:

[youtube]7Na9ljCg4Lk[/youtube] [youtube]i7yCxD4Ekpo[/youtube]







[size=4][b]CHANGE LOG:[/b][/size]
- DAWNGUARD DLC now in use! The chapel has been renovated to use Soul Cairn and Vampire resources to create a darker cathedral.
- Lighting has been adjusted to provide a continuous ambiance while still adjusting to a day/night cycle.
- Six beds for followers and/or children.
- New master bedroom included with garden above overlooking the river!
author: ClefJ
